question.title: EhCache3 giving error while setting expiry
question.body:
I was trying to setup ehCache3 on my spring boot application (3.5.5) and in the ehcache.xml whenever I try to setup expiry tag, it gives an error saying that it is expecting a different tag.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<config xmlns:xsi='http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance'
        xmlns='http://www.ehcache.org/v3'
        xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.ehcache.org/v3 http://www.ehcache.org/schema/ehcache-core.xsd">

    <cache alias="tokenCache" uses-template="defaultTemplate">
        <resources>
            <heap unit="entries">1</heap>
        </resources>
        <expiry>
            <ttl unit="minutes">30</ttl>
        </expiry>
    </cache>

    <cache-template name="defaultTemplate">
        <key-type>java.lang.String</key-type>
        <value-type>java.lang.String</value-type>
        <heap unit="entries">1</heap>
    </cache-template>

</config>

This is the exact message: Invalid content was found starting with element '{"http://www.ehcache.org/v3":expiry}'. One of '{"http://www.ehcache.org/v3":heap-store-settings, "http://www.ehcache.org/v3":disk-store-settings, "http://www.ehcache.org/v3":service-configuration}' is expected.

This is the dependency in my pom.xml

<dependency>
            <groupId>org.ehcache</groupId>
            <artifactId>ehcache</artifactId>
            <version>3.10.8</version>
        </dependency>

Can it be that the expiry tag was moved inside some other tag. Appreciate the help, Thanks!

question_comments.body: Does this answer give you any help? stackoverflow.com/questions/44165149/echache3-xml-parsing-is‌​sue/…
